problem: {name} saw {x} birds in their backyard and threw a stone at them, scaring away 1/{y} of that number. A few minutes later, {z} more birds joined the fearless birds. How many birds are now in the backyard?
solution:
The total number of birds scared away after he threw the stone at them is 1/{y} * {x} = <<1/{y}*{x}={birds_scared}>>{birds_scared} birds.
The total number of birds remaining is {x} - {birds_scared} = <<{x}-{birds_scared}={birds_remaining}>>{birds_remaining} birds.
If {z} more birds joined, the total number of birds in the backyard will become {birds_remaining} + {z} = <<{birds_remaining}+{z}={ans}>>{ans} birds.
#### {ans}
